And nostalgia is the most

Like can we fuckin' sell shit?
Losing is comfortable.
Losing is delicious.

Your destiny is your destiny.

So, we're very,

So, that's why we have Gary here.
So, ladies and gentlemen, no introduction needed,
Gary Vaynerchuk!
(applause)

Thank you.
Super pumped to be here.
Obviously a lot of friends that I know intimately,

Yeah, you know, obviously a lot of
what I've been focused on for the last couple years

Which I think at the end of the day,

I'm and will always be concerned

Can it become boring?
And there's a lot of you that really know me,

There's really only three or four true kind of like

Luckily for me, and luckily for so many of us,

all the same shit that happened on every other platform

And what I mean by people getting old

"What do you think is gonna happen with Uber?"

it was really interesting to see where people

But to me the Q and A and the banter

And like just really, it was crazy.

And so you know, obviously whether it's entrepreneurship

the reason VaynerMedia has gone from 30 to 650 people

And then consumer behavior,

So, thrilled to go anywhere,
I'm real excited to do Q and A and thanks for having me.

You gonna run it?
Great.
Let's just get into it.
Just name and question.

This Friday, my brother A.J. who's been the C.O.O.

AJ and I are really different,

the C.O.O. of the company,

Over the last year and a half we knew this was coming

You know the truth is and
something I've been talking a lot

I really run VaynerMedia.

for me, every operational

And I think the key,

I think the key for me in having a number two,

it's more about them

Like, I'm very self-aware. Right?
For example, knowing that 20% of you, a lot of you

knowing that 20% of you didn't even like me

like self-awareness is imperative.
And as an operator, I'm very self-aware

And so I think for anybody here that's looking to scale,

And that's super real.
And I think we all know that.
And we have strengths and weaknesses and I think,
I've been a guy,
and I've watched a lot of companies do this at scale,
I really believe on tripling down in your strengths.
I do not, I'm not a big fan on working on your weaknesses.
I think you have to be dangerous in your weaknesses,
like I'm not a dope when it comes to the finances
or the other things that I don't wanna do,
but I'm far from being interested
in being world-class in it,
It just doesn't leave enough room
for you to be world-class at what comes natural to you,

So, it's been AJ, it's gonna be James,
I'm building something else,
I don't know, I'm sure a lot of you that have

one of the things that I realize and I realize I did at

So there's gonna be these six people and they're my family,
they're the inner circle, they're the people

Everybody's got that inner circle,
and by the way,
some of them are ranked number five in the company,

so now I'm gonna make it official

When there's that level of trust,
I think sometimes people silo a level of trust

like one or two people,
I actually am looking for scale,
and so I'm gonna build a five, six person team

Like we just landed one of the biggest banks in the country.
I can't even announce it yet.
One of the biggest banks in the country,
it's gonna be 30% of our revenue,
it's an enormously big client,
I really need to make sure it goes well.
I need to put everything on it

So they'll keep an eye on that.
And they'll keep an eye on this one employee

so the other thing I would give a recommendation to

is building an inner circle that everybody in the company
knows is you.
Just even the five people
within an organization in that group
won't even have a title within it.
It's just gonna be, that's what they are.
Office of the CEO.
Something to consider that I see a lot of value in.
Thanks for your question, man.

Instagram, yes,
